sect2.title: init
sect2.para: init is the first program that runs when Retro Rocket starts. It takes care of the initial setup: mounting filesystems, loading drivers, creating a RAM disk, and finally launching the shell (rocketsh).

listitem.para: Sets the default library path for BASIC programs.
Mounts system filesystems such as /devices and /boot.
Creates a 1 GB RAM disk at /ramdisk so you have scratch space to save and run programs in LiveCD mode.
Displays the boot logo and prepares the screen.
Finally, launches the shell (rocketsh). If the shell ever exits, init simply restarts it.

sect3.title: Usage
sect3.para: You never need to run init yourself - it is started automatically at boot.

sect3.title: Installed systems
sect3.para: When Retro Rocket is installed to a hard disk, the init program is just another BASIC program stored under /programs. This means you can freely edit it, customise it, and even replace parts of the startup process to suit your own needs.

listitem.para: On the LiveCD, init is fixed.
On an installed system, you are in full control - itâ€™s your startup script.
Be careful: if you remove or break the call to rocketsh, you may end up without a shell!
